intro: Lathyrus gladiatus, commonly known as the sword vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Lathyrus gladiatus is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
